key_risks: Regulatory and legal issues including account freezing and data breaches
Dependence on third parties for partnerships and operations
High market competition impacting market share and profitability
Reputation risks due to involvement in controversial financial products
controversies: Settlement with the New York Attorney General's Office for illegal account freezing and debt collection practices
Significant data breach affecting over 800,000 users leading to a class-action lawsuit
social_issues: Criticism for fees and transparency issues related to tax-related financial products
Ethical concerns over consumer protection in lending practices
governance_issues: Compliance risks and potential reputational damage from legal settlements
Inadequate data protection measures leading to a major data breach

sources.title: Pathward in S.D. settling claims it illegally froze client accounts
sources.snippet: Pathward Financial will pay about $700,000 in refunds and penalties to resolve claims by the New York Attorney General's Office that the Sioux Falls, S.D., company illegally froze customer accounts and transferred funds debt collectors. ... Pathward will also pay a $627,000 penalty to address "illegal and deceptive conduct," according to ...

sources.title: Pathward to pay refunds, penalty tied to NY AG investigation
sources.snippet: The NY AG's investigation found that Sioux Falls, South Dakota-based Pathward " regularly sent debt collectors funds that were government benefits or that should have been subject to the protected wages threshold." From 2016 to 2022, Pathward illegally froze some 1,400 accounts belonging to New Yorkers, James's office said in the release.

sources.title: Pathward class action claims company failed to safeguard personal info ...
sources.snippet: Pathward class action lawsuit overview: Who: Plaintiff Jacob Kent filed a class action lawsuit against Pathward NA, Ipswitch Inc. and Progress Software Corporation. Where: The Pathward class action lawsuit was filed in South Dakota federal court.
